actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 110 (Sen. Rounds):
        A resolution honoring the life and legacy of the late James George Abourezk.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 111 (Sen. King):
        A resolution recognizing the importance of maple syrup production to Maine and designating March 26, 2023, as "Maine Maple Sunday".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 112 (Sen. Tester):
        A resolution designating the week of February 27 through March 3, 2023, as "Public Schools Week".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN2:
        Laura Taylor-Kale, of California, to be an Assistant Secretary of Defense

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 68 - 26. Record Vote Number: 59 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, vote to be determined.


 PN6:
        Ravi Chaudhary, of Virginia, to be an Assistant Secretary of the Air Force

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 64 - 29. Record Vote Number: 57 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 65 - 29. Record Vote Number: 58 



 PN29:
        Eric M. Garcetti, of California, to be Ambassador to the Republic of India

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 42. Record Vote Number: 55 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 42. Record Vote Number: 56 



 PN122:
        Brent Neiman, of Illinois, to be a Deputy Under Secretary of the Treasury

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 40. Record Vote Number: 54
Under the authority of the order of today, at  7:16 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Ms. Hassan in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
